Package vinyl

Class Record

java.lang.Object
vinyl.Record
public class Record extends Object
A shallowly immutable carrier for a fixed set of values, determined by the record header. Values are stored in ordered correspondence with the header fields. However, record values are primarily accessed via a type-safe accessor that accepts a field or a field-pin.

Records can be viewed as simple java objects, whose "fields" are fixed at instance-creation time, rather than class-declaration time. This trades some unsafety (a user may attempt to access fields that a record does not contain) for the ability to dynamically introduce new "shapes" of records - a pre-requisite for many relational operations.

Records have a natural definition of equals(), hashCode(), and toString(), based on the record header and values.

  • Method Details

    • header

      public Header header()
      Returns the record header. The header fields are in ordered correspondence with the record field values.
      Returns:
      the record header

    • values

      public List<Object> values()
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the record field values. The values are in ordered correspondence with the record header fields.
      Returns:
      the record field values

    • get

      public <T> T get(Field<T> field)
      Returns the value associated with the given field in this record, or throws NoSuchElementException if this record's header does not contain the field.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value
      Parameters:
      field - the field whose associated value is to be returned
      Returns:
      the value associated with the given field
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if this record's header does not contain the field

    • get

      public <T> T get(FieldPin<T> pin)
      Returns the value associated with the given pin's field in this record, or throws NoSuchElementException if this record's header does not contain the pin's field at the pin's index.

      This is an optimized lookup that takes advantage of the field index being known in advance.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value
      Parameters:
      pin - the pin whose field's associated value is to be returned
      Returns:
      the value associated with the given pin's field
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if this record's header does not contain the pin's field at the pin's index

    • isNil

      public boolean isNil()
      Returns true if this is a "nil" record that was synthesized to pair with an unmatched record in an outer (left/right/full) join. If true, all of the record field values are null.
      Returns:
      true if this is a "nil" record
      See Also:
      • RecordStream.leftJoin(vinyl.RecordStream, java.util.function.Function<vinyl.JoinAPI.On, vinyl.JoinPred>, java.util.function.Consumer<vinyl.JoinAPI.Select>)
      • RecordStream.rightJoin(vinyl.RecordStream, java.util.function.Function<vinyl.JoinAPI.On, vinyl.JoinPred>, java.util.function.Consumer<vinyl.JoinAPI.Select>)
      • RecordStream.fullJoin(vinyl.RecordStream, java.util.function.Function<vinyl.JoinAPI.On, vinyl.JoinPred>, java.util.function.Consumer<vinyl.JoinAPI.Select>)

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Returns true if and only if the given object is a record with a header and values equal to this record's header and values, respectively.

      equals in class Object
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns the hash code value for this record. The hash code of a record is derived from the hash code of each of its values.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      the hash code value for this record

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this record. The string representation consists of a list of field-value associations, in the same order as the header fields, enclosed in the braces of "Record{}". Adjacent associations are separated by the characters ", " (comma and space). Each field-value association is rendered as the field followed by an equals sign ("=") followed by the associated value. Fields and values are converted to strings as by String.valueOf(Object).
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this record
